intro: Malesherbia lactea var. crassicaulis, commonly known as the thick-stemmed milkweed, is a succulent plant native to South America. It features thick, fleshy stems that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces small, pale green or yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically oval and covered in a fine, white powdery coating. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
